results:
Here are the search results for Narnia references in modern pop culture, TV shows, movies, music, and memes from 2024-2025:

## Major Narnia Developments in 2024-2025

### Netflix's Upcoming Narnia Film
Netflix announced that Greta Gerwig's "Narnia" project would hit IMAX theaters on Thanksgiving Day 2026, with the film debuting on Netflix a month later, on Christmas.(no content)Producer Amy Pascal has described Gerwig's vision as "a very new take on Narnia," saying: "It's all about rock and roll."

### Star-Studded Cast
Academy Award-winning actor Meryl Streep is also rumored to be joining the project, with sources saying Streep is in talks to play Aslan, the Great Lion who serves as Narnia's guardian in the franchise.(no content)The latest name to join the mix is Carey Mulligan, who is reportedly in negotiations to play the mother of Digory, with the cast also including Daniel Craig as Digory's uncle, and Emma Mackey as the Jadis, the White Witch.

## Narnia in Pop Culture References

### Television Shows
In an episode of Friends, Chandler gets defensive about his "nubbin" when Ross asks "if it does anything", and replies: "Why yes Ross, pressing my third nipple opens the delivery entrance to the magical land of Narnia." In the British comedy series, The Young Ones (episode "Flood") – Vyvyan enters a wardrobe whilst playing hide and seek and enters Narnia, where he is met by the White Witch and her dwarf sleigh-driver who offers him Turkish Delight but is repulsed by his bad breath.

### Music References
The Swedish Christian progressive metal band, Narnia, is named after the series, as well as some of their songs and lyrics. The Roar of Love – a 1978 album by Christian band 2nd Chapter of Acts tells the story of The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe in the shape of a musical play.(no content)A song by the band Relient K is titled "In Like a Lion (Always Winter)", referencing the White Witch's prolongment of winter in Narnia from The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe. The lyrics also read "It's always winter, but never Christmas/ it seems this curse just can't be lifted," which references her prevention of Christmas.

### Film Parodies
A parody of the epic film genre, the film references The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, The Da Vinci Code, Harry Potter, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Pirates of the Caribbean, X-Men and Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle in the movie "Epic Movie."

The search reveals that Narnia continues to be a significant cultural touchstone, with major developments including Netflix's high-budget adaptation directed by Greta Gerwig, numerous musical references across genres, television comedy references, and ongoing parody films. The upcoming 2026 Netflix film represents the most significant Narnia pop culture event in recent years.
